headline: Staff Assistant at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

defaultPosition.description: Chief Financial Officer / Office of Budget and Program Performance performs budget analyst duties - budget formulation and execution.
defaultPosition.title: Staff Assistant

positions.description: Chief Financial Officer / Office of Budget and Program Performance performs budget analyst duties - budget formulation and execution.
positions.title: Staff Assistant

positions.description: Office of Financial Management performs budget formulation, budget execution, mission support, and HR support duties.
positions.title: Staff Assistant

positions.description: United States Coast Guard provide project management support services for the Major Acquisition, Construction, and Improvement for the Patrol Boat and Medium Endurance Cutter Mission Effectiveness (MEP) and Great Lakes Icebreaker (GLIB) Projects. Budget formulation, spending/budget execution, financial management and reporting, documentation and plans, cost estimation, accounting and asset capitalization.
positions.title: Analyst/Consultant

positions.description: United States Coast Guard provide financial management support services for the Major Acquisition, Construction, and Improvement for the Buoy Tender (WLB) and Great Lakes Icebreaker (GLIB) acquisition projects. Maintained obligation plans, budget execution, and financial administration of both projects. Conduct market research analysis on open procurement files and provide auditing activities on both procurement and accounting files.
positions.title: Budget/Financial Analyst

positions.description: United States Coast Guard International Affairs Staff.  Administrative, financial, accounting and mission support for U. S. Coast Guard International Maritime Training.
positions.title: Program Financial Analyst

positions.description: United States Coast Guard International Affairs supported international training missions. Coordinated procurement of supplies and services, logistics, travel for training programs in both the United States and overseas. Coordinated agreements with other government agency programs such as foreign and U. S. sponsors.
positions.title: Junior Accountant

positions.description: Perform operational budget formulation and execution duties, financial administration work for assignments ashore and afloat. Monitoring commitments, obligations, and actual expenditures to ensure proper allocation and timely obligation of funds. Reconciliation and reporting, purchasing, property management, warehouse, inventory, transportation and supply/services support. Warranted Contracting Officer, purchasing agent for small purchase transactions, sharing agreements with other government agencies, administer hazardous waste program, implement satellite SATO travel office, and financial system administrator.
positions.title: Storekeeper 1st Class
